Label: Chicano Classification System
Corporate Name: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library
Summary: Chicano Classification System, first draft, July 1974 by José Antonio Arce, with subsequent additions through approximately 2001. The system is based in part on the Library of Congress Classification System, with specialized expansions and adaptations for use in the Chicano Studies Library.
Notes: Includes several insertions and manuscript annotations
Single-sided, with occasional scrap paper content on versos.

Label: Prospectus for a Chicano Periodical Index Project
Corporate Name: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library
Summary: Budget and project timetable from a prospectus for the Chicano Periodical Index Project, prepared by Richard Chabrán, January 1978.

Summary: Contents list for section 9, and price list for microfilm sections 1-11, of the Chicano Studies Library Serials Collection; section 12 is listed as forthcoming, December 1992.

Label: Chicano Studies Library Donor Reception Invitation
Corporate Name: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library
Casa Joaquin Murrieta (Berkeley, Calif.)
Summary: Invitation and program for a Chicano Studies Library donor reception, recognition ceremony, and dinner. The event was held April 23, 1993 at Casa Joaquin Murrieta, and sponsored by the Chicano Studies Library and the Casa Joaquin Murrieta, and speakers included Benicio Silva, Luis de la Garza, Lillian Castillo-Speed, Maria Ortiz, and several others.

Label: Undocumented Scars Exhibit Publicity Flier
Corporate Name: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library
Sociedad Locura Artística del Barrio
Summary: Announcement of an exhibit and reception of contemporary Raza art featuring the artists' group Sociedad Locura Artística del Barrio (SLAB). The exhibit was held in the Chicano Studies Library, April 20 through May 31, 1992, and the reception was held at the Unitas Christian Fellowship, May 6. 1993. Artists included Viviana N. Arellano, Alexandro Cbarrubias, Eduardo Espinoza, Ernesto Espinoza, Ramon Ramirez, and Manuel "Chato" Salazar. The announcement also gives thanks to Lillian Castillo-Speed and the Chicano Studies Library.

Label: Staff Meeting Minutes, March 3, 1989
Corporate Name: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: CU News. (Volume 48, Number 22, June 10, 1993)

Label: Chicano Thesaurus for Indexing Chicano Materials
Corporate Name: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library
University of California, Santa Barbara. Library. Colección Tloque Nahuaque
Committee for the Development of Subject Access to Chicano Literatures
Publisher: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library.
University of California, Santa Barbara. Library. Colección Tloque Nahuaque
Summary: The Chicano Thesaurus, in its first edition, 1979, published jointly by the Chicano Studies Library at U.C. Berkeley, and the Colección Tloque Nahuaque at U.C. Santa Barbara. It was compiled by the Committee for the Development of Subject Access to Chicano Literatures: Richard Chabrán, Roberto G. Trujillo, Elva Yañez, Rafaela Castro, Francisco García, and Oscar Treviño. The thesaurus served as an indexing tool for the Chicano Periodical Indexing Project and for cataloging and indexing of other library collections related to Chicano literature and experience.
Notes: First edition. Most of the approximately 700 entries are in English, although some are in Spanish

Label: Chicano Database Press Release, with Logo

Summary: A press release for the Chicano Database project including a description of the project and projections for its future.

Label: Anglos and Mexicans in the making of Texas, 1836-1986 (title page and preface)
Summary: Cover and page xii (Acknowledgements) only, acknowledging the Chicano Studies Library, and Richard Chabrán, among other libraries and librarians.

Label: Bibliography of Writings on La Mujer
Summary: A bibliography of literature on Chicanas, compiled by Cristina Portillo, Graciela Rios, and Martha Rodríguez, 1976.

Label: Chicano Resource Journal and Service Handbook (Fall Quarter, 1972)
Corporate Name: Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlán (Berkeley, Calif.)
Summary: Extract from the Fall 1972 of the "Chicano Resource Journal and Service Handbook" from the Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlán (MEChA), including cover, dedication, table of contents, and excerpts mentioning the Chicano Studies Library, and the Latin American Library in Oakland.
Topic: Movimiento Estudiantil Chicano de Aztlán (Berkeley, Calif.)

Label: Educación en Luz Symposium
Corporate Name: Mujeres del Movimiento (Berkeley, Calif.)
International House (Berkeley, Calif.)
Summary: Agenda for a symposium titled Education en Luz, sponsored by Mujeres del Movimiento and held at International House, Berkeley, California, May 17, 1975.

Label: Chicano Library Staff at UFW Headquarters in Kern County
Summary: Professor Juan Rodriguez, Library staff and librarian Rafaela Castro visiting UFW headquarters to discuss the UFW library archive. Pictured: (front, left to right) Oscar Treviño, Richard Chabrán, Rafaela Castro; (back, left to right) Juan Rodríguez, unknown UFW staff.

Label: Chicano Library Staff in Work Room, 102 Wheeler Hall
Summary: Library staff taking a break, in the work room, 102 Wheeler Hall. Pictured: (background) John Gonzalez, Richard Chabrán; (foreground) Oscar Treviño.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: At Front Desk in the Chicano Studies Library
Summary: Lillian Castillo-Speed and student workers stand at the front desk of the Chicano Studies Library. Pictured: Lillian Castillo-Speed, Julieta Carrillo, unknown student worker.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: Memorial for Cesar Chavez
Summary: Students look at the memorial in honor of Cesar Chavez outside the Chicano Studies Library. Pictured: Adele Martinez, unknown.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: Birthday Celebration in the Chicano Studies Library
Summary: Staff celebrate Lillian Castillo-Speed’s birthday in front of the stacks in the Chicano Studies library in 1994. Pictured: (left to right) Luis de la Garza, two unknown student staff, Lillian Castillo-Speed, Carlos Delgado.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: Día de los Muertos in the Chicano Studies Library
Summary: Student celebrates Día de los Muertos in the Chicano Studies Library while another student studies. Pictured: Luis de la Garza, unknown student.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: Día de los Muertos Celebration at the Chicano Studies Library
Summary: UC Berkeley community members attend a Día de los Muertos Celebration at the Chicano Studies Library. Pictured: Professor Larry Trujillo, Marisol Zapater (CSL Staff), Robert Allen (Ethnic Studies Professor), Wei Chi Poon (Asian American Studies Librarian), other unknown individuals.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: Lillian Castillo-Speed in Chicano Studies Office
Summary: Lillian Castillo-Speed in one of the offices at the Chicano Studies Library, 104 Wheeler Hall. This room was where the Chicano Database was updated and maintained. The blackboard was where database planning was mapped out.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: Lillian Castillo-Speed Packs the Office
Summary: Lillian Castillo-Speed packs up the office in the Chicano Studies Library in preparation for the move to the new Ethnic Studies Library.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Chicano Studies Library

Label: Lillian Castillo-Speed Opening Remarks
Summary: Lillian Castillo-Speed speaks at the Ethnic Studies Library opening celebration, July 18, 1997. Also pictured in the foreground: Ling-Chi Wang.
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Ethnic Studies Library

Label: Opening of the Ethnic Studies Library
Summary: Library staff stand before attendees at the Ethnic Studies Library opening celebration, July 18, 1997. Pictured: Lillian Castillo-Speed, Janice Otani (archivist), Mary Young (Native American Studies Librarian), Wei Chi Poon (Asian American Studies Librarian), Jeannie Imazumi (Library Assistant), Marisol Zapater (Library Assistant)
Topic: University of California, Berkeley. Ethnic Studies Library

Label: Boycott U.C. Dining Facilities Poster
Summary: A poster for a boycott of University of California dining facilities.

Label: Viet Nam/Aztlan Poster
Corporate Name: Chicano Vietnam Project
Summary: A poster from the Chicano Vietnam Project, expressing unity and solidarity with Vietnam. The multicolor, bilingual poster reads: Viet Nam, Aztlan, Đoàn kết chiến thắng, Unidos venceran, Đoàn kết, Solidaridad, Chicano, Viet Nam, Fuera. The credits read: ©Chicano Vietnam Project, P.O. Box 331, Berkeley, Calif., 94701, Malaquias Montoya.
